website_summaries.verdict: A quality toaster oven with a large capacity. Customers rave about the choice and control this product gives.
pros: Off the charts in terms of performance and features
Includes a 3-position baking rack and generous set of bake ware
cons: Rare complaints about digital display screen

website_summaries.verdict: Meal prepping requires a lot of oven space – this toaster oven is big enough to cook full meals inside so you can focus on other things.
pros: Light-up, LED screen is easy to use
Large enough to fit 6 pieces of toast or a 13-inch pizza
Comes with a roasting pan and pizza pan
cons: Requires 4 inches between the toaster and all surfaces (apart from the counter it sits on)

website_summaries.verdict: Consider investing in this trusty, solid and clever toaster oven if you plan to use yours for serious cooking and as long as you're not turned off by a $249 price tag.
pros: The Breville Smart Oven is a well-made, smartly designed appliance that performs consistently well
cons: Some of the cooking presets don’t work very well, and its "smart" functions aren't all that obvious

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased April 2015, died Dec. 7 2016 -- a few months after warranty. When you pay $250 for a Toaster Oven, it should last more than 18 months. While it worked -- and I used it almost every day -- it worked very well. I used it for everything from morning toast, to roasting veggies and meat. It performed these tasks well. Until today, when it just died -- probably something in the fancy electronic control system burned out. Even if you could find someone to do it, most likely not worth the time and cost. My advice, buy something much cheaper. Then, if it does in a year or so, you wont feel as cheated as I feel today.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This oven WAS working great until today
customer_reviews.text: This oven WAS working great until today... it just died on me while toasting some bread. No indication, or warning whatsoever that anything was amiss. It just completely went dark halfway through toasting; disappointed as we've only had this for 22 months, and this is one of the more expensive toaster ovens on the market at the time we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: non stick pans will crack
customer_reviews.text: I've had this toaster oven since July 2014. The oven itself is good. We use it often. But the pans they included - a pizza sheet and roasting pan - within months they started cracking. The coating cracked I should say. So I put aluminum foil over it because it would be dangerous to cook with it otherwise. This is what it looks like currently. That's not dried food. It is the black non stick surface peeling off.
customer_reviews.author: janices

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in January 2015. Great oven, but began having problems starting about 15 months old. Just shy of 2 years now and the unit doesn't work. Some of the issues: One: The panel flashes like a strobe light and has to be unplugged to clear the problem. Two: the oven heats up to the desired temperature but shuts off after the door is opened to insert the food. Too much money for an oven that works for less than 2 years. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Was great oven but fan just died
customer_reviews.text: We loved this oven. Worked very well and easy to use. However just under two years of moderate use and the fan has broken. This apparently is a common problem amongst many that these ovens have after a year of use. It’s very disappointing that these ovens have no durability.
customer_reviews.author: Friscoboy

customer_reviews.title: Takes a bit of time to heat up
customer_reviews.text: This oven died today after 3 years of use. The problem is, you cannot buy replacement parts. At this price, I expected the oven to last longer or at least be repairable. Nope! Not going to buy from Breville again. Update: I was actually able to find a replacement circuit board and installed it myself. The oven is still working for us after almost 5 years. Our only gripe is that it takes a few minutes to fully heat up.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony V. DeRosa

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this oven!!! It lasted 19 months then we got an error code E05. The Manual states that error code means there is “a non-resettable issue with the appliance”. We really liked this oven until it failed. It is too expensive to be failing so quickly. Poor quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great until the fan breaks (two in a row)
customer_reviews.text: Since I discovered these Breville toaster ovens back in 2015 I have been through two. Both of them suffered from noisy convection fans that eventually just stopped spinning and instead made an electrical hum. Just happened to my second one today. I’ll continue using it as long as the standard heating elements still work but I’ll never buy another one of these overprice yuppie appliances again. They are great until they aren’t. Consider that I could have bought half a dozen ‘regular’ toaster ovens for the $600 I wasted on these two.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Love this oven!
customer_reviews.text: I have had many toaster ovens over the years, and this one is, by far, the best in all aspects.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: An expensive lemon
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the cheap plastic control knobs, this oven was great while it worked, which was 1 year and 3 months. One fine day the heating elements stopped working, but the LCD still worked. A little Googling revealed that this is a common problem caused by a burned out control board (if even the LCD doesn't work, you've got a blown thermal fuse, an even more common problem). I replaced it with a Cuisinart TOB-260 because of its three-year warranty (and it came with a pizza stone). I miss the Breville's much better designed controls (separate knobs for function, time, temperature, etc.) compared to the Cuisinart's idiotic single knob for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Algernon Wyse

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage, in under two years the convection function stopped working which upon Googling seems to be a common problem, and now after just over 2 years it has completely died. No excuse for that for a product in this price range, the one it replaced was $75 and lasted 7 years before it gave out. Buyer beware, you’ll love it at first but be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: John Paterson

customer_reviews.title: Lasts two years.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Breville oven, which I bought two years ago. The first one completely stopped working after two years too, and honestly, I thought maybe it was something that I had done to make it konk out so quickly. I loved the oven, so I bought another. This one is on its last legs. The spring that engages a magnet that allows the timer to count down stopped connecting, so the oven has to stay open a crack to count down. If I don't allow the oven to count down, it shuts itself off after awhile. These appliances aren't cheap and I think they should last longer than a couple of years. I won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: The Inspired Designer

customer_reviews.title: The Toaster Oven is roomy inside and compact outside
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that the oven toasts both sides of the bread at the same time. It also accommodated a large casserole dish to cook Eggplant Parmesan on Bake. On Warm, it will take rolls, dinner bread and vegetables. It is very easy to clean...you just slip the crumb tray out and wash it off. The only negative feature is that you have to slide the crumb tray out to open the door.
customer_reviews.author: susan t bigger

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this oven in May 2015. Was pretty happy with it until about November 2018 when it died. Customer support left me on hold until I couldn’t take it anymore, and hung up in frustration. Controls are kinda loose and imprecise, but worked well enough. I suppose the best thing about oven was that it cooked like a true convection oven ( not as well as my Wolf oven ). Besides the controls, the oven was relatively well made except for the fatal flaw of not lasting very long. WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: james  Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: You'll use it everyday.
customer_reviews.text: I love this oven. This is my 3rd Breville oven, and I use it about everyday. The toaster part is fantastic, baking cookies is another big plus. I use my oven for everything that needs to be baked. Not heating up the whole kitchen to bake a pie in the summer months encourages me to bake more often. I only use my larger oven when we have a group of friends over.
customer_reviews.author: Mama B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful counter top oven. Baked everything from classic apple pie to classic pound cake to glazed salmon. After preheating, the circular pizza baking sheet is excellent for baking from scratch pie crusts in Pyrex pie dishes as it helps brown the crust's bottom.
customer_reviews.author: p47dude

customer_reviews.title: Non-resettable error E05 on 2 different units!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but feel compelled to in order to warn potential buyers of this product. The first unit that was delivered gave us a non-resettable error “E05” after 1 use. The manual said to unplug immediately and contact Breville. We contacted Amazon and they sent us a replacement (we returned the defective unit). Guess what? The 2nd unit also gave use non-resettable error E05 - on the first use - less than 5 minutes! I will never buy another Breville appliance again!
customer_reviews.author: L. Detsky

customer_reviews.title: Something burned up........1.5 years old
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this oven, but now something happened as to where we smelled burnt electronics emanating from it. And the convection feature doesn't work either, which we used constantly. We have had this toaster oven for about a year and a half and it's literally 'toast.' Nice try Breville, you lost a once convinced loving customer.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last 3 Years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this top of the line appliance because it had such great reviews, but three years later the fan has started making an awful noise. I know it is a matter of time before it quits completely. The average life of a toaster oven is 5 years. I did not get 5 years from this appliance. Won't buy Breville again!
customer_reviews.author: D&J

customer_reviews.title: We really loved this item
customer_reviews.text: OK, they force the star thing, but wanted to get the attention of potential owners. We really loved this item. Easy to use and works fantastic. However, nowhere in the manual does it warn against using Oven Cleaner on it. Upon trying to clean the glass buildup, we used 'Easy Off' oven cleaner. It dissolved the finish off the door frame, and any overspray also dissolved the finish wherever it went. While we thought the unit was stainless steel of some sort, it appears it is not. In the trash it goes. Thought purchasers should know, and the manufacture should be clear about not using cleaners other than 'non-abrasive'.
customer_reviews.author: CJInFL

customer_reviews.title: It works so much better than our Bosch oven
customer_reviews.text: We have been dealing with a wonderful looking but slow heating Bosch oven for several years. With our Breville we can heat the oven compartment in only a few minutes, which actually makes us want to bake or broil more. The manual is thick but it is because the features are numerous. The only additional item we bought was the Breville cutting board, which is designed to sit on the top of the oven. All other items useful to us (rack, broiler pan and slotted insert, and the pizza pan) were included as part of the package. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Young

customer_reviews.title: Multi-function energy saver
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve used it for baking, broiling, cooking frozen food and reheating, and it’s done well with those functions. It’s designed to bake a regular size pizza, but it’s just a bit too small for a 13 x 9 baking pan, which is disappointing. Two 8” cake pans won’t fit, but baking one layer at a time produced a nice, moist layer cake. The convection feature is a time and energy saver. It’s much more convenient to use than my large electric oven, and doesn’t heat up the kitchen. Overall, its versatility and ease of use make it a useful addition to the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger M

customer_reviews.title: BREVILLE FREE REPLACEMENTS ARE POSSIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased Breville BOV800xl in Aug 2018,and now in Sep 2019,oven has gone haywire.Tried repurchasing thru Amazon w/annoying screw up during delivery.Canceled the order, and in doing so discovered the ability to order direct thru Breville[no less expensive].Explained to agent what had happened, and was informed, that my Breville,was indeed, still under warranty[18mos.]and I was eligible for FREE replacement.Saved $300 plus.I am a happy camper.I must say, that the Breville,did perform, with excellent results, when it was working,and the reason,I had ordered it again.
customer_reviews.author: capitolhillrose

customer_reviews.title: Great ATK recommendation
customer_reviews.text: Great second oven. I can roast a chicken, broil a steak, bake scones, cookies, brownies, biscotti, loaf bread, and pizza dough. Also makes evenly browned toast. The display is hard to read because I keep it on a shelf over the fridge (the display is meant to be looked at directly not from below).
customer_reviews.author: NYC Man on The Street

customer_reviews.title: Product broke down after 16 months
customer_reviews.text: This oven was bought on May 2014, and it breaks down on September 2015; 4 months after the warranty expired. The bottom heating elements aren't working any more. We are very disappointed at the quality and durability of this product. For something cost $250 we'd expect it to be more durable and a bit long lasting. $250 for less than 16 months of use is just unacceptable. When Breville wants to charge $119 to repair their short lived product, this is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly for 10 years+
customer_reviews.text: We bought our first oven over 10 years ago and used pretty much daily. We never had any issues with until the "Start/Power" button required holding your moth right to get it started. Everything else worked perfectly. Nevertheless we ended up giving it away and ordered another one a year or so ago. As with the first one, the unit works perfectly, we've had no issues with it, and honestly don't expect to. I see all of the one star reviews. The only thing I can say, is that that hasn't been our experience
customer_reviews.author: EPVC

customer_reviews.title: Does not have a long life of working properly for the price
customer_reviews.text: I too loved this at first, purchased Nov 2016, its now July 2018 and though it still works at the moment it is making very loud humming sounds from the fan area like its about to give out. I did not expect to pay top dollar for this not to last very long. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Bought in November 2014, still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I don't cook a ton, but when I do, it's only ever portions for one or two. I tend to use this instead of my oven because it's faster and uses less energy. I bought this admittedly expensive Smart Oven 5 years ago, but it still looks nearly new, and still works perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Z.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little oven. Never use my regular oven any more.
customer_reviews.text: Have wanted this Breville for ages. Two friends have this model and rave about it. Finally bought one and I’m loving it. Haven’t used my regular oven at all since buying. Have baked, broiled, toasted with and without convection and everything has been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jillmac

customer_reviews.title: This oven WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: After using a cheap toaster oven, it was clear that if I wanted one that really works I would need to spend the money. This one had high ratings from Consumer Reports and it lives up to those ratings. Mine has cooked everything from brownies to fresh berry pie to a whole chicken, and it makes perfect toast! Now we are using it more than the big oven, probably saving energy. Everything I have asked this oven to do, it does exceptionally well! Plus it is easy to operate and clean. I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: farm folk

customer_reviews.title: Efficient Oven
customer_reviews.text: My regular oven door wouldn't close all the way, but, during the time of CoVID, I couldn't get it repaired. I bought the Breville Smart Oven to cook my protein. While I can't cook as much at one time as I could in a regular oven, this oven did the job and did it well. I use it for toasting bread also. The Breville has many uses, but I mainly use it for roasting and toasting. I highly recommend this product. You'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S.

customer_reviews.title: After 5 1/2 years...
customer_reviews.text: Still looks and cooks good. Bought this after using son's $120 Panasonic many times. Then 'ruining' it with absent minded use of plastic plate. After buying a replacement for him, we started shopping for ourselves and this looked the best. Been using it several times everyday for every small toasting or even small baking jobs. Like biscuits and pot pies. Temp control on ours is accurate and browning is more even than you would expect. BTW. That Panasonic cleaned up fairly easily and is still in use. So if you want small cheap value for money, it's good too. Just a whole diiferent class
customer_reviews.author: Jim A

customer_reviews.title: Broiler function caused a fire
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great at first. It worked very well and saved me a lot of cool/prep/clean up time until I used the broiler function for the first time. Within the first minute, it started smoke and smell of plastic. By the time I reached it, the heating elements were in flames. It took less than two minutes for thing to go up. Since it was less than 6 months old, Breville will replace it but i’ll never, ever leave leave the kitchen while it’s on again.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite kitchen appliance!!!
customer_reviews.text: We use our Breville Smart Oven every day and absolutely love it!! I was hesitant to buy such an "expensive toaster oven", but I would highly recommend it. This Smart Oven is like a second oven in our kitchen. We make everything in it...cookies, brownies, toast, pizza, bagels, chicken, lasagna, chicken nuggets, reheat meals, pretty much anything you would bake/reheat/toast in a toaster, regular oven, microwave, or toaster oven. It is the most accurate toaster oven I have ever owned. Toast and poptarts have never tasted better and I love using it to reheat leftovers. It also has a temperature setting, so you can bake or reheat at any chosen temperature. Seriously, worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: MKeswick

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one. Not even 6 months in and it stops heating. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Foochoo

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money, I bet a cheap one would last longer.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about four years, I expected more for the price. Warranty only lasts ONE year!
customer_reviews.author: Pennylee

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Thanksgiving Day after less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This was our second Breville oven so we obviously liked this product, but we received a fatal EO5 error while cooking Thanksgiving dinner. Thanks Breville for cheeping out on quality. I would never buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaced toaster
customer_reviews.text: So glad to replace toaster with a multi-purpose CONVECTION toaster oven! My son has had one for years and we loved using it just to make toast. Now that we own one, it's used more than our conventional oven and the microwave-convection oven. The are varied enough that we've found new uses! Toast, bagel, bake, roast, broil, pizza, cookies, reheat, warm. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: NonnaB

customer_reviews.title: Keeper!
customer_reviews.text: I returned a Panasonic toaster and decided to take the higher price plunge with the Breville toaster. The quality of build is night and day. Operation is easy and straight forward. Most importantly it toasts well! Oh yeah it also bakes well and all that without emptying the oven of all the cookware i've stored in there so the kiddos gets everything from tostinos to fresh baked cookies! Just pickup one of those mini baking sets made for toasters and you wont go wrong with the Breville!
customer_reviews.author: PiyoPiyo

customer_reviews.title: Love all things Breville
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this smart oven in May 2014 and it is still working perfectly. Easy to use and reliable. Absolutely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Barrenness of a Busy Life

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Appliance
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to spend this much money on what I essentially purchased as a toaster oven but it turned out to be so much more. First, it's large, I can cook almost anything in this. Next it broils steak beautifully, which for me is a luxury because I have an electric oven and I can never get the good outer coating that seals in the moisture that this oven can do. There is a slight learning curve because it cooks differently, but once you understand how it works it cuts down on cooking time significantly. I use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R

customer_reviews.title: No regrets ☺️
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little oven. Perfect size and easy to use. Cooks quickly and evenly, even toast. Bagels come out better than ever. This has become my primary oven and I find myself cooking more than I used to. In the summer I wouldn’t even think about using the oven so I wouldn’t. This oven is more summer friendly than the regular wall oven. I’m not going to lie, it puts out some heat but not nearly as much. Smaller area to heat up and everything cooks faster. Win win! I read the reviews so I purchased the extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Maria

customer_reviews.title: Reliability
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oven for my daughter and SIL in December 2013. They love it, and have not experienced any problems with the oven. I bought the BOV845BSSUSC on June 2, 2020, hoping that I have the same results.
customer_reviews.author: William O. Plaster Jr.

customer_reviews.title: almost burned down my house!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oven because I had bought a cheap one and it was not very good. I bought it in March of 2015. about 15 months later it almpst burned down my house. Now if you turn it on, it doesn't turn off, and you have to unplug it to get it to turn off. It burned my toast the other night and might have burned down my house if we had not noticed the smoke. I am absolutely livid that this very expensive oven has malfunctioned in this manner less than a year and a half after purchase. BUyER BE WARE!!!!! I am contacting the manufacturer about this dangerous machine.
customer_reviews.author: john bliven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent convection oven, okay toaster
customer_reviews.text: Have been looking at this oven for quite a while and when it went on sale Black Friday I got it. Yes it is pricey but has performed very well for what I need. During the month we have had the oven, it is doing a great job with baked goods, roasting vegetables and casserole type jobs without turning on big oven in the stove Toasting is not as good but gets the job done for the number of times used for that. Easily holds a 9" x 12" pan with room for air circulation. Controls are easy to read and use. Very glad I finally got it.
customer_reviews.author: Grandeb NJ

customer_reviews.title: Built to last until the warranty rolls around
customer_reviews.text: Really upset because, like so many others, I had this toaster oven for 13 months before it decided to stop heating. It turns on and the display works, but it doesn't heat anymore. It's so expensive and it did its job when it was working, but for the price I paid, I expect it to last me years, not make it to the end of the warranty and then stop working. Very disappointed in what was initially a great product.
customer_reviews.author: jendorbell

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I ever made! I bought one for each of my daughters WELL.
customer_reviews.author: Deborrah Richey

customer_reviews.title: No Light? No problem....
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite happy with the oven, and can't really add anything to all the other great reviews. I dinged it one star for the lack of an internal light, but I came up with an acceptable solution (for me anyway). I attached a clip-on goose-neck LED light to the handle - (from I**A). Since it moves with the door it doesn't interfere with access, is not affected by the heat, and can be easily removed and reattached at any time (the photo was taken with no other lighting)
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Did not last !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this oven 2 years ago, worked well generally. The convection fan started to rattle, then the toaster died. For the high price point, I expected a longer lived toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Grady 225

customer_reviews.title: Nice toaster oven but beware the control panel
customer_reviews.text: Nice toaster oven but beware the control panel. This unit has a history of control panel failures........ My $250 oven had a failure of the panel after 20 months of service! You would expect more from a small appliance. I contacted Breville but heard nothing back from them!
customer_reviews.author: TimC

customer_reviews.title: A great second oven
customer_reviews.text: A great counter top second oven, handles a large chicken or tenderloin easily. The smart features are nice, I just like having a second convection oven. We have multiple homes and I have one of these in each kitchen. I did not see the need to get the upgraded one because I don't need a light or slow cooker function (I have a standard oven for that). If what you mostly want is the convenience of a second oven, this one will delight you for years (had one of mine for 3 years now).
customer_reviews.author: Tim Post

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best toaster oven available
customer_reviews.text: Prefer this toaster oven over all others. The controls are intuitive; no need to even read the instructions. The exterior top of the oven does get quite hot in use, which could be a "pro" if you use it as a plate warmer; otherwise, it could be a "con." Another potential con is that Breville says their provided trays are not dishwasher safe. We wash them in the dishwasher anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Theophrastus

customer_reviews.title: 1yr update-- replaced less expensive brand... this could be ok
customer_reviews.text: 1st impressionis very favorable...seems well constructed... easy to read dials and display (i dont need my glasses) and oven is dimesionally as described...my first cook used the presets (cookies) and got good results. will followup in 3 months with an update... sept 2019 we cook for two and use this sevaeral times per week (seldom use larger oven) still working great..we use it for light baking and quick cookies. I feel it struggles with large items... I do not try to fill the whole space. yes I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: The Critic

customer_reviews.title: The useful life is too short for the high price tag!
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s time to find another toaster oven. Our third one has just died and even though I loved this toaster oven I refuse to buy a forth to just have to replace it again in a few years. For the steep price tag they need to have a longer useful life...
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Oven But Has Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: I've used this oven for about 2 months and (so far) it's done a wonderful job. It toasts very evenly and it's large enough to bake the average frozen pizza. It's easy to program and remembers programs from one time to another. The only complaint I have is something that I consider a major design flaw ---and that is the fact that it's impossible to fully open the oven door unless you pull the crumb tray out five or six inches beforehand. I can live with this flaw (although it is very frustrating) because the oven does a good job aside from this problem.
customer_reviews.author: pitg

customer_reviews.title: ... this expensive toaster oven thinking it would necessarily be better than the others
customer_reviews.text: I bought this expensive toaster oven thinking it would necessarily be better than the others. I was wrong! This oven didn't cook my toast fully, so I thought that I had done something wrong. I then realized that the heating elements on the bottom weren't working. This happened when I first bought the oven and it started happening again after the warranty expired. Their support people gave no trouble shooting advice at all. Then they told me how I could buy another toaster oven at 20% off. I told them I would never buy another one off their products and I advise everyone to stay away from this oven.
customer_reviews.author: Brian F

customer_reviews.title: Great oven
customer_reviews.text: This sucker rocks! I have had it for 8 months and love it. It does everything advertised. Toast comes out a bit lighter than I think the gauge shows, easy enough to adjust and also depends on the sugar content of the bread being used. Cooks a frozen pizza quickly. Really heats up when in convection mode. When you get one, definitely read all of the directions first. They are a great guide to getting the most out of your oven and how to properly use it.
customer_reviews.author: MARK A SHOW

customer_reviews.title: Convection fan failure
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Breville Smart Oven two years ago. Soon after purchase the convection fan began to make a noise. Otherwise the oven worked well. Perhaps the fan noise was part of the breaking-in process, we thought. However, in the fall of 2015 the motor stopped running altogether. The oven could still function, but without the convection feature. Breville was unwilling to replace the entire unit, since it was out of warranty. They offered to repair the oven for a fee of around $120 or to sell us a new one at a 30% discount. We chose that option. I believe that this issue could be fairly common--a design flaw. The support person at Breville was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: DPS

customer_reviews.title: Died in just under 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Bought August 28th 2015 and it died August 25th 2018. We were gradually increasing the darkness of the toast in order to get the same toast as when we ordered it. Cost per year to own was very high and we are therefore disappointed with the value of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Error E05
customer_reviews.text: Oven looks nice but, unfortunately, as functioning toaster oven it is poor. We are on our second oven in 4 months. The first worked for a month or so before it started to terminate the cooking process randomly with an E05 error code. Called customer support and they sent a replacement. Replacement ovens first use terminated with E05 and has happened randomly ever since. Customer phone support is now not even taking messages, not even an option to chat online. I have filled out the support form online, received a case number but didn't even receive an email with my case number. Glad I took a screen shot anyway but still...
customer_reviews.author: RockHound

customer_reviews.title: When it was the only out there - perfect but now want to level up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and then saw the new one that air frys - so i canceled right away to review the bigger one. This one showed up at my door a couple days later. I have had 2 of these in many years - but i want the air fry one to get more stuff off my counters.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Szul

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest toaster oven I've ever owned, and I have to say, it's fantastic! The build quality feels premium, all of the parts slide and move nicely, the oven cooks very evenly, it heats up quickly, and it keeps the heat well insulated. I only cook for 2 people, an and as a result, this toaster oven has completely replaced my regular oven. I liked this toaster oven so much, I even gifted one to my parents for the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Defective temperature dial, had to return
customer_reviews.text: Defective temperature dial, had to return. Dial had a loose feel, and jumped around the readout, could not adjust temperature to my desired setting to save my life. Luckily, Amazon has a great return policy/protocol, so I had no issue shipping it back for a full refund. To not risk another defective dial from the same lot, I opted to order theinstead. I figured any issues that reviewers have had over the years with the 800XL have been addressed with the 845BSS...hopefully. The 845BSS is fantastic, and has a light. So if you're going to buy Breville, might as well buy that model.
customer_reviews.author: Organization Freak / Hobby Cook

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Little Oven
customer_reviews.text: I'm so in love with this oven!! I haven't used my full-size oven since I bought this. It's wonderful. Preheats quickly, cooks/broils/roasts/toasts beautifully, looks great, and is surprisingly compact. It has also saved me a bit of money because here in Chicago, electricity is much less costly than gas, and I have a gas range. I don't know how I survived without it! If you're on the fence about buying one, I highly recommend that you take the plunge.
customer_reviews.author: BeautyAdornsVirtue

customer_reviews.title: Old model lasts much longer than new model!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster oven in 2011. It lasted for more than 6 years. Then the top elements stopped working. My husband bought me the newest model at that time for Christmas in 2017. Alas, it lasted for almost 2 years and broke down last week. It squeals and makes funny noises. After reading the reviews of the latest version which includes the air fryer feature, I decided to stick with the old model. It’s sad that newer doesn’t mean better.
customer_reviews.author: EEMVan

customer_reviews.title: and there is no easy way to fix it
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product in July 2015 and it recently shorted out. I suspect the thermal fuse blew, and there is no easy way to fix it. Disappointing that such an expensive item would break after 2.5 years; we previously had a $40 Black & Decker model that lasted ~10 years. Breville said our only option was to pay $120 to ship the item back to them and they would repair it. No thanks, I'll just buy a replacement oven that is just as good for 50% of that cost. I would steer clear, as there are cheaper alternatives that are more reliable for substantially less money.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Allessio

customer_reviews.title: Was great, for 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oven in June 2016 and have been very happy with it - until now. In the past week, the convection fan has acted erratically and is now completely dead except for a hum. And, the oven does not heat to the set temperature as it used to. After the preheat completion indicator has sounded, it takes 10-25 minutes longer for the oven to reach the set temperature. I am very frustrated with these developments as it met my needs completely before now. But I sure do not want to spend $250 every two years for this appliance.
customer_reviews.author: KHPJJ

customer_reviews.title: If it lasts I will update to a 5 star
customer_reviews.text: We had the same model before, last time, within 16 months the display fizzled, and only showed some info. The rest worked fine but it was hard/impossible to read/guess the temp. Loved the oven, all of the modes, baked, toasted, everything worked great. We made toast, cookies, roast beef, chicken, pizza, biscuits, baked potatoes, brownies, cakes, muffins, cup cakes, pork loin, frozen french fries, etc. We rarely use our regular oven and have a family of 4. In fact, our regular oven died in Nov. and we haven't replaced it, but that was the reason for replacing our old Breville was we needed to be able to read the screen to be able to use it full time.
customer_reviews.author: Pictures Galore

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Breville is my favorite brand. This is literally like having a big oven in a small package. Works perfectly and don't even use my huge oven anymore
customer_reviews.author: Dez

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality component/longevity.
customer_reviews.text: Unit lasted 11 months. Main selector switch has gone bad. Cannot return. I thought Breville was a premium product. Functioned well when it worked. Too bad. Now pita repair/replace research. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Tom2903

customer_reviews.title: one Star
customer_reviews.text: Excellent oven, we use it daily. Update: I purchased this oven (6-24-2016) it worked great up until now (2-4-2018). While trying to use it today it flashed inside the oven and now it will not heat at all 7 months after the warranty. Not very durable. Update: I ordered a heat sensor from (Ereplacement parts) on 2/19/18 since Breville does not supply parts i just got an email 3/26/18 from Ereplacement Parts that Breville has not yet sent them the part. I guess Breville does not stock replacement parts or there are so many ovens that are broke they can't keep up. Don't buy this oven !!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Keeton

customer_reviews.title: Bought in 2011 and have loved this oven until about 6 months ago when it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2011 and have loved this oven until about 6 months ago when it stopped cooking the food thoroughly. All controls appear to be working including pre-heat where the oven gives you an aural tone indicating it has reached its cooking temp. Hard to tell if the heating elements have failed or the thermometer. I give it 3 Stars as a compromise between 1 Star because it has become unusable to 5 Stars, which I would have given it for the first 5 years of its life.
customer_reviews.author: 4Papa

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster oven out there
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best toaster oven I have used. I can actually bake in it (with a little tweaking). Easy to use, easy to clean. All the settings a great. I have used several other "highly rated" toaster ovens, but I needed one that could be sort of an oven replacement. This fits the bill perfectly. The accessories that come with it are quality. It looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still makes good toast, with controls for how many slices of ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this one for several years, (don't remember when I bought it,) & use it nearly everyday for toast, biscuits, fish, fries, chicken, etc. Toasts well on one side, the other side is OK, but because of the heavy wire grill that is built to hold baking dishes, you will have the stripes where the wire protected the bread from the heat. Still makes good toast, with controls for how many slices of bread & number of slices,up to 6 normal size, 4 large rectangle sizes. Has settings for English muffins or anything that you want just one side toasted. Best toaster oven I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Class Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Your Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: A friend owed one of these and my wife thought it would be a worthwhile addition to our kitchen appliances. She was so right. My initial thoughts about the purchase was really to toast bagels nicely. She had bigger plans. She uses it like a second oven, cooking casserole, baking bread, pretty much any thing you would do in an oven. It is very simple to use, the controls are intuitive and easy to understand. It is a nice size, fits well on the counter next to the coffee maker. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tarheel fan

customer_reviews.title: A good performer and it also makes proper toast
customer_reviews.text: I love this oven. I have been looked for a toaster oven that actually makes good toast, so I could get rid of the extra toaster. This makes proper toast, browned as desired and not dried out inside. Having passed that test, it also performs well in all it's other functions. I like the bagel and pizza settings, and have used the convection baking setting with great results. The broiler is also a good feature- it broils quickly and at the temperature selected. I've had it for about 8 months and so far, not a single problem. Oh, and it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Athene Five

customer_reviews.title: No replacement parts available.
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed while it worked. Failed during 2nd year of ownership. Parts are not available. Service from factory exceeds purchase cost. Very disappointed and will not consider Breville brand in searching for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Was great while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: We used this toaster oven everyday. Was sad to see it completely die at the 2+ year mark. We had hoped it would last much longer than that after spending $250 on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: I love this toaster oven
customer_reviews.text: I love it so much I bought a second one for a vacation home. I am able to use it for everything from making toast to baking potatoes to broiling fish and chicken. Any small baking or broiling task. It is probably the most used item in my kitchen. Expensive but I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Mac

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS! We've had this toaster oven for one year and one month and it just completely DIED on us out of no where. Now we can't do anything about it because it's one month past the warranty. Do not waste your money on this!!!! It was amazing when it worked but clearly it's not worth the investment - stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this oven. I never use my big oven and barely use microwave now. Cooks everything from snacks to full meals. I cook chicken. Roasts. Pizza. Muffins. Pretty much everything. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: You need this.
customer_reviews.text: The convection button on this fancy lil’ oven will up your frozen pizza and break-and-bake cookie game to a whole other level, son! I can never go back! I have literally never used the full-sized oven in my kitchen because this one is TOO GOOD.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Neither option is really fun when you just want toast
customer_reviews.text: This oven has a flaw to die after 3 years. The thermal fuse will blow and you will need to spend time/money to fix it. Customer service will offer to fix or sell you a new one. Neither option is really fun when you just want toast. You can however fix it yourself. Here are details on the fix and issues people have had with control board and with the thermal fuse. It has been a great oven. A little frustrating that it suddenly blows 3 years after light use (single person use it for occasional toast and roasting fish).
customer_reviews.author: Picard

customer_reviews.title: Cooks evenly and efficiently
customer_reviews.text: I love a great toaster oven! We often use this instead of a microwave or when the oven is full. It’s the perfect size and it’s the most efficient toaster oven I have ever owned. It also has great lines so it looks nice on your counter.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Waechter

customer_reviews.title: I've never had an oven like this.
customer_reviews.text: I've never had an oven like this...can't really call it a toaster oven anymore since it does so much. It is large enough to accommodate most all of my needs and has worked very well. It's nice not to have to turn on my wall ovens every time I need to cook or toast something. I wish the plug didn't have to be so large because it makes it impossible to push back against the wall very far (although when in use I pull it away from everything).
customer_reviews.author: Rosanne L.

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny.
customer_reviews.text: From the very first use, this toaster oven has exceeded my expectations. It's very precise from the number of slices to toast and the darkness, to the convection settings when baking. I previously owned a nice, middle grade Cuisineart that did a decent job. But this Breville makes my old convection toaster oven look like an Easy-Bake Oven. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wylarn

customer_reviews.title: Bakes potatoes that turned out nice, and used to to toast bagels did a ...
customer_reviews.text: Only received this a few days ago. Bakes potatoes that turned out nice, and used to to toast bagels did a great job, and it does a great job reheating foods without the toughness or sogginess encountered when reheating in a microwave. Cons: it was smaller than anticipated, there is no clock, and it could use a light in the oven and in my opinion for the costliness of this Smart Oven it should have both the light and the clock functions. Other than these I think it will prove to be a great purchase. After several researching numerous websites and consumer responses this item is by far the best on the market which is why I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: CLFDPOPS1

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster oven we've owned by far
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Hands down the best toaster oven we've ever owned. The volume is fantastic. It often saves me from turning on the oven and is big enough to provide the additional oven space I need when cooking bigger meals. It cleans up very nicely. The controls are easy and it even tells you where to place the rack based on the type of cooking you are doing--a thoughtful touch. From bagels to lasagna, it turns out great results. If you have the counter space to accommodate it, I would not hesitate to buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Quahog

customer_reviews.title: Mine died after 20 months; previous only lasted 2 years
customer_reviews.text: My previous Breville also died (lasted 2 years). I'm investigating getting this one fixed, but at the conclusion that these are simply attractive, well marketed, but poorly made and short-life appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Billy A.

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased with this oven and how it cooks
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this oven and how it cooks. Size is great for cooking for two. My only complaint is that it doesn't have an interior light - and I'm disappointed as they do offer another model for just a bit more that does have the light...but I didn't realize that until after I had received and used this one - so my fault for not researching better. I do love it in all other ways though.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, multifunctional unit
customer_reviews.text: Works well for everything from a warming oven to making decent pizza. Not a lot of heat lost to it's direct exterior. Happy with it so far
customer_reviews.author: Dr John

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster oven ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute best toaster oven ever made. We use it daily, multiple times and it could easily replace our high end Viking oven for days at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Gt

customer_reviews.title: VERY loud fan noise - waiting for replacement: Replacement is good
customer_reviews.text: Just received it -did the first time use burn-in, VERY loud and rattling fan. Reviews and Questions say fan should be quiet and noise negligible. Have requested a replacement from Amazon and will update when we see how the new one sounds/works. Disappointing but not Amazon's fault - box was sealed and brand new. Makes me wonder about Breville's quality... Followup. Amazon provided a new unit yesterday. Very quick response! New unit works great, fan is quiet and unobtrusive (as it should be). Haven't used it for much yet, but expect good results. Great job Amazon! Breville, maybe do a little more Quality Control.
customer_reviews.author: G Malow

customer_reviews.title: Super Functional
customer_reviews.text: The Breville toasts bread perfectly, broils, roasts, reheats, has a plate warmer, and can do everything that my oven and toaster used to do. It can fit a 4 pound chicken for roasting. It can cook a small pizza. The convection oven feature is great for roasting. It looks good on my counter. It is larger than a standard toaster oven, so it takes up more counter space; however, the Breville has excellent utility and is more than worth the counter space!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Pavan

customer_reviews.title: A must have for my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! I seldom use my oven since I purchased this smart oven. I use it to bake bread, pizza...just about anything for which I would use my oven. It is great for reheating, warming, toasting. It's also easy to clean and keep clean. I would hate to be without it now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: This little oven is great. We have been using it for about 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife had wanted a toaster oven for years. We bought this one for temporary use after our main oven died. This little oven is great. We have been using it for about 2 years. It does make wonderful toast, but also pizza, standing rib roast, and just about anything else that will fit into it. So, even after our main oven was replaced, we kept this thing on the countertop and use it regularly (as in just about every day). We are completely satisfied with this oven. If anything happens to it, we will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: swalker

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love the magnets in the door that pull the rack out when you open it. I also enjoy the knob that changes my he setting so if you have something you always cook it retains those settings instead of setting it each time you cook. It’s just the three of us so we’ve used a toaster oven for many years instead of using the large one.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wallis

customer_reviews.title: No regrets, excellent investment!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this oven two years ago through Amazon, and it's been one great investment!! I use it for almost everything! I cook salmon, warm up my food, have made pizza, cookies, toast, broiled, and everything comes out perfectly every single time!!! Never had problems with it, and specially I cook all my meals at home so I carry my food on the go.
customer_reviews.author: macarari

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect size of cooking implements
customer_reviews.text: I have used with great satisfaction the muffin pan that is part of the implements purchased. Regrettably, the size of the long baking pan and the long baking sheet do not fit my model. They are too large making my experience with the product a disappointment. I am glad this review was sent as it affords hope that the appropriate size, suitable to my model, can be shipped to me. Doing so will likely change my opinion of my overall satisfaction with the product. Please respond according. Timothy Boyd
customer_reviews.author: W Timothy Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Good room with easy to use controls. The two things that could be negatives would be that the magnets that help draw out the grill (when the door opens) sometimes slide out too far and you have to push it back in. One might burn themselves. The second would be that the skin gets pretty warm. Not itll burn you warm but be mindful about location.
customer_reviews.author: James

product_meta.title: Breville BOV800XL Smart Oven 1800-Watt Convection Toaster Oven with Element IQ, Silver
product_meta.description:
Attribute BOV450XL: Mini Smart Oven BOV650XL: Compact Smart Oven BOV800XL: Smart Oven Dimensions 16x13x9 inches 16.5x15.5x10.25 inches 18.5x16.25x11.25 inches Capacity 11 inch pizza, 4 toast slices 12 inch pizza, 4 toast slices 13 inch pizza, 6 toast slices Element IQ? Yes Yes Yes Wattage 1800 1800 1800 Heating Elements 4 (quartz) 4 (quartz) 5 (quartz) Convection No No Yes Pre-set functions 8 8 9 Accessories Baking pan Baking pan, broil rack Baking pan, broil rack, pizza pan Compare Breville's Smart Ovens  WHY THE BREVILLE SMART OVEN?
 Every Breville product begins with a simple moment of brilliance. The Breville Smart Oven began with the simple fact that different foods require different methods of heating: some, like baked goods, need to be cooked evenly; others, like meats, need to be seared on top. Most toaster ovens fail to distribute heat in a consistent way throughout their interiors, let alone change heat distribution to suit the different foods being prepared. This is how the Breville Smart Oven stands apart: whatever the food, it adjusts its heat distribution for perfect results.

For toast, high heat from top and bottom evenly crisps the outside of toast but doesn't dry out the inside (left diagram), while for baking 1500W are distributed among four elements for gentle heat and even cooking (right diagram)  AN OVEN THAT DOES THE THINKING FOR YOU 
 The Smart Oven is equipped with Element IQ cooking technology, which adjusts the power of the five individual quartz heating elements to cook food more evenly and quickly. This sophisticated heating system distributes heat throughout the oven when and where it is needed, to guarantee more efficient cooking. Nine different menu options allow users to choose the best setting for the food they are cooking. In addition to dynamically distributing heat to different areas, the Smart Oven can adjust the wattage of its heating elements for even more cooking flexibility. Most ovens have elements with fixed wattage that can only switch between ON and OFF, but Element IQ functions much like a dimmer on a light switch, increasing or decreasing element power with a simple turn of the knob.

The Breville Smart Oven comes with 3 acccessories: a pizza pan, baking pan, and broil rack.  For example, broiling requires high heat from above in order to melt and brown, so the Smart Oven activates 1500W of high heat from the top elements of the oven. On the other hand, toast needs to be cooked evenly on both sides without drying out the inside, so the Smart Oven uses high radiated heat from above and below (1800W distributed between four elements) to crisp the outside quickly.

 Baking utilizes another feature of the Smart Oven that contributes to even heating: convection heating. Convection cooking uses a fan to circulate hot air so all sides of the food cook at the same rate. This is particularly important for baked goods, such as cookies and cakes, which need to be cooked evenly all the way through.

 Each of these nine functions is preset with recommended settings, taking the guesswork out of cooking. However, each can be customized according to recipe, volume of food, or personal taste. Customized settings will remain in the memory of the oven until changed or until the oven is unplugged from the wall outlet, streamlining your cooking process.

 DESIGNED WITH THE CONSUMER IN MIND
 The Smart Oven is carefully constructed from the most durable materials. It is attractively housed in Reinforced stainless steel, a striking addition to any kitchen. The elements themselves are composed of quartz, rather than the metal elements found in other toaster ovens. Quartz responds more quickly to heat change, which results in more even heating throughout the oven. The roomy interior is coated with a non-stick material that can safely withstand high temperatures, making cleanup easier. A crumb/drip tray that is accessible from the front of the oven (rather than the back, like many other toaster ovens) also makes it easier to clean between cooking sessions. In addition, the oven includes a patented magnetic auto-eject rack: small magnets embedded on the sides of the oven door pull the wire rack halfway from the oven when the door is opened, making food easier to remove and preventing burns.

 GOLDILOCKS PROPORTIONS
At 18.5 x16.25 x11.25 inches, the Breville Smart Oven is not too small but not too large. It is larger than most toaster ovens, with space to comfortably fit six slices of toast, a 13-inch pizza, or a whole Chicken. However, as a countertop convection oven, it is more space-efficient than a conventional wall oven. A smaller oven means less time to heat up and less time to cook, perfect for preparing a meal in a hurry (or for cooks who like to create in the heat of the moment). This also translates into a cooler kitchen (particularly convenient in the hot summer months) and less energy consumed.

Click on image to view larger PRODUCT FEATURES


 a.   Easy-clean, stainless steel housing with ribbed plate warming tray
 b.   Non-Stick Interior with 3 rack positions
 c.   13” pizza, 6-slice toast capacity
 d.   Tempered glass door
 e.   Magnetic auto-eject rack
 f.   5 quartz elements with Element IQ for smart cooking
 g.   Back-lit easy-read LCD that calculates the correct the time and temperature, illuminating orange during preheating and cooking and blue once the cycle is complete
 h.   Function dial with 9 pre-set cooking functions: bake, broil, roast, cookies, reheat, pizza, bagel, toast, warm
 i.   Temperature and time dial with auto shut-off and sound alert
 j.   Easily removable pull-out crumb tray.
feature_bullets: Element IQ delivers the right power at the right time and when adjusted to taste, remembers
1800 Watts with 5 quartz heating elements. Capacity: 6 Slice Toaster, 13 inch Inch Pizza. Voltage 110 120 Volts
Backlit, easy read LCD changes from blue to orange when cooking
Exterior Dimensions: (W) 15¾ x (D) 18½x (H) 11 ; Interior Dimensions: (W) 13¼ x (D) 11¼ x (H) 5¼ ; Weight: 22 pounds
Place the oven on a flat, dry surface. Ensure there is a minimum distance of 4” (10cm) of space on both sides of the appliance.
9 present functions: Toast, bagel, bake, roast, broil, pizza, cookies, reheat and warm. Voltage: 110 to 120 Volts
